description:
Variation of condition 2 (approved drawings) of planning permission PP/2015/2275 dated 19/10/2015 for the construction of a terrace of 5 two storey; 4 bed  dwellings; incorporating accommodation in the roofspace with basement level; 5 car parking spaces, bike parking spaces; refuse storage, landscaping and private amenity space, following demolition of an existing two storey
  detached dwelling
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission PP/2015/2275 dated 19/10/2015.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers  BR-003; BR-005; BR-006; BR-007; BR-008; BR-009; BR-010; BR-011; BR-005; BR-006; BR-007; BR-008; BR-009; BR-010; BR-011; 233-15-01; 233-15-03; 233-15-04; 233-15-05; 233-15-06
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on drawing reference 233 - 15 - 07 (Rev: B) shall be provided in accordance with the details approved under application PP/2015/2275 dated 19/10/2015.  The facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied.

Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Boroughs waste reduction targets having regard to National Planning Policy Framework (2012) - Section 7 - Requiring good design, London Plan 2016 policies 3.5 and 5.16, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD.

| Soft landscaping and acoustic fencing indicated on drawing reference 233 - 15 - 07 (Rev: B) approved under application reference PP/2015/2275 dated 19/10/2015. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and to preserve the visual amenity of the area in accordance with policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7.4, 7A and 7B, policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (f) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016.

| A minimum of ten cycle parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with the details approved under application reference PP/2015/2275 dated 19/10/2015. Such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.

Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) - Section 4 - Promoting Sustainable Transport, Ealing's Sustainable Transport SPG   London Plan policies 6.9 and 6.13

| The construction of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the construction logistics plan approved under application PP/2015/5693 dated 22/12/2015. The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents, local environmental conditions and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 5.21, 6.3, 7.14, and 7.15  of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD.
| The design of the building shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Secured By Design standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2016.
| The dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards.
Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers/users, in accordance with policies 3.8 and 7.2 of The London Plan 2016

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no extensions, alterations or other works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties, future residents of the development and the appearance of the area, in accordance with relevant policies of the National Planning Policy Framework - Section 7 Requiring good design, London Plan policies 7.4 and 7.6, Ealing's Core Strategy policies 1.1(g) and (h) and policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing Development Management.
